results.title: Serving People
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Customers and clients want to be served in a positive way. Frontline staff should use greetings and names, show respect for unusual requests, be sensitive to cultural differences and overcome language barriers.

results.title: Serving in silence: the Margarethe Cammermeyer story
results.creator_credit: Richard Heus, Tri-Star Pictures and Jeff Bleckner
results.brief_description: Based on a true story and made for television, this film starring Glenn Close and Judy Davis garnered the film 3 Emmys, including Outstanding Individual Achievement in Writing for a miniseries or Special, in addition to Best Actress (Close) and Supporting Actress (Davis). It tells the story of successful army nurse Margarethe “Grethe” Cammermeye who, after disclosing her sexual orientation, inadvertently closes the door on any avenue for promotion, thus earning her the dubious status of being the highest ever ranking officer dismissed for being a homosexual. Executive producer - Barbra Streisand.

results.title: Serving food
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Army
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Hospital food service personnel training”.
Emphasises principles of food preparation and service in hospitals - proper temperature, correct quality, selection of food to meet patient’s requirements, and courteous attention buy food service personnel.

results.title: Service Leadership
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Exceptional service begins with senior management a service leadership involves staying in touch with the customers, leading by example, creating a “service culture” and gaining staff commitment.

results.title: Service Burnout
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Service burnout is a stress reaction suffered by frontline and service staff. Addresses physical and emotional symptoms, effects on customer service, prevention of burnout and how to remedy existing cases of burnout.

results.title: Service at sea in the marine police
results.creator_credit: B.H. Hipkins, Malayan Film Unit and D.S. Green
results.brief_description: A Malayan constable volunteers to join Malaya’s Maritime Police. After a period of seamanship training he is posted to a police launch operating in coastal waters. As a member of the crew he takes part in patrols searching for smugglers, gun-runners and other undesirables.

results.title: Serrated tussocks
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Describes the damage done by serrated tussock in pastures and the difficulties in controlling it. Cultivation of competitive improved pastures and chemical treatment coupled with efficient farm management have proved successful.

results.title: Series and parallel circuits
results.brief_description: This film explains the relationship between resistance, current, and voltage in both series circuits and parallel circuits. The advantages and disadvantages of each type of circuit is vividly demonstrated; typical problems are presented; and a simple series-parallel combination is illustrated and explained.
results.description: This film explains the relationship between resistance, current, and voltage in both series circuits and parallel circuits. results.title: Series 7
results.creator_credit: Dendy Films, Blow Up Pictures, Killer Films, Open City Films, Jason Kliot, Joana Vicente, Christine Vachon, Katie Roumel and Daniel Minahan
results.brief_description: The Contenders is a TV reality game show in which six contestants, given a gun and a camera, are challenged to assassinate the other five and win the game. In “Series 7” an eight-month pregnant Dawn is the reigning champion, who, by winning, will free herself from further participation. This series is played in Dawn’s hometown and one of the contestants is a former boyfriend and one true love, Jeff, dying of cancer. The film explores the morality of reality TV, satirising the public’s obsession with seeing ordinary people suffer, interact, live - and in this case - die. Voice-over narration comments on the action as if it were a football game; the network plays re-enactments of footage that’s been lost; the audience participates by revelling in their live participation of the murders. There is a sickeningly insipid presentation of graphic violence, as contestants blithely bait, maim and shoot each other. This blandness is compounded by the pedestrian cinematography that makes this film uninteresting to view for its aesthetics but compelling for its politics. Cast includes Brooke Smith, Marylouise Burke, Glenn Fitzgerald, Michael Kaycheck, Richard Venture, Merritt Weaver. Some scenes may disturb.
